729054f-a.text:
Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road), east side, 400 yards north of Arthur Kill Road, showing the International Ultramarine Works. Th buildings are situated near the shore of Arthur Kill. The view i northward. Johnson Ave. runs north from Arthur Kill Road to Arth Kill, midway between Ellis Road and Chemioal Lane.
October 6, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

728427f-a.text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, south side, at Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road). The view shows members ofCClay Club and a monument of Staten Island clay constructed in an old clay pit near the abandoned railroad
tracks of the International Ultramarine Works.
June 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A more distant view of the monument.
June 17, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Members of the Clay Club at work on the monument.
June 17, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

728429f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, 200 yards east of Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road). The house is attuated 800 yards back of Arthur Kill Road, on the shore of Arthur Kill. In 1874 it was located on property belonging to J. Woglaa. and from 1898 to 1917 the property belonged to the International Ultramarine Works. The dates refer to maps on which
the property owners' names appear.
June 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
728429f-a.original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Johnson Avenue
728429f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Johnson Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729050f-b.text:
(1)
JJdhunson Ave. (or Shore Road), west side, about 700 yards north of Arthur Kill Road and 150 yards south of the shore of Arthur Kill, showing the Johnson (Johnston) House (1853-1874). In 1898 it belonged to 0. C. Graves, and in 1907 to Louise M. Giegerich. In 1917 it was the property of Chas. W. Graves. The dates refer to maps on
which the owners' names appear.
November 25, 1922.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A full front view of the house.
November 25, 1922.
P. L. Sperr.

729051f-b.text:
(1)
Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road), west side, abeut 700 yards north of Arthur Kill Road and 150 yards south of the shore of Arthur Kill, showing the Johnson (Johnston) House (1853-1874). In 1898 it belonged to G.C. Graves, and in 1907 to Louise M. Giegerioh. In 1917 it was the property of Chas. W. Graves. The dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear. The view
is southwestward.
October 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view of the house in a northeasterly direction. Johnson Ave. runs north from Arthur Kill Road to Arthur Kill midway
between Ellis Road and Ohemical Lane.
June 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
